summary: Internal FBI email chain discussing procedures to identify FBI Victim Specialists (VSs) who assisted victims in the Epstein/Maxwell cases, in response to a request from the U.S. Attorney's Office (USAO). The emails propose methods to locate this information through case numbers, victim notification letters, and FBI databases like Sentinel.

persons.name: Program Manager
persons.role: Program Manager, Victim Program Management Unit, FBI Victim Services Division
persons.context: Author of the main email proposing a process to identify Victim Specialists who worked with Epstein/Maxwell case victims, and mentions notifying HQ OGC about the USAO request.

events.title: Internal FBI discussion on victim specialist identification
events.description: FBI Victim Services Division staff exchange emails to develop a method for identifying which FBI Victim Specialists assisted victims in the Epstein/Maxwell cases, prompted by a request from the U.S. Attorney's Office.

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office (USAO) made a request to the FBI Victim Services Division for information related to the Epstein/Maxwell cases.
The FBI was attempting to identify which specific FBI Victim Specialists (VSs) had worked with victims of Epstein and Maxwell.

Proposed methods to find this information included using case numbers, pulling Victim Notification System (VNS) letters sent to victims/attorneys, and checking victim names in the FBI's Sentinel database and VS monthly reports (VSATT).
Victim notification letters were not sent to all victims; when sent, they went directly to the victims' attorneys.
The Program Manager indicated they would notify the FBI Headquarters Office of the General Counsel (HQ OGC) about the USAO's request.
